content.prompt_es: Choose the correct option to complete the sentences in reported speech.
content.explanation: En el discurso indirecto, el tiempo del verbo cambia al pasado. 'Am going' cambia a 'was going'.
content.stimulus_en: She said, 'I am going to the party.'

options.text: She said she was going to the party.
She said she is going to the party.
She says she was going to the party.
She said she goes to the party.

content.explanation: Cuando se reporta una pregunta, cambiamos el tiempo y la estructura, de 'do you like' a 'if I liked'.

options.text: He asked if I liked pizza.
He asked if I like pizza.
He asked did I like pizza.
He asked whether I like pizza.

content.prompt_es: Choose the correct option to complete the sentences in reported speech.
content.explanation: El futuro 'will' cambia a 'would' en el discurso indirecto.
content.stimulus_en: They told me, 'We will finish the project tomorrow.'

options.text: They told me they finish the project tomorrow.
They told me they finished the project tomorrow.
They told me they would finish the project tomorrow.
They told me they will finish the project tomorrow.

content.prompt_es: Choose the correct option to complete the sentences in reported speech.
content.explanation: El presente perfecto 'have seen' cambia a 'had seen' en el discurso indirecto.
content.stimulus_en: John said, 'I have seen that movie before.'

options.text: John said he has seen that movie before.
John said he had seen that movie before.
John said he saw that movie before.
John said he was seeing that movie before.

content.prompt_es: Choose the correct option to complete the sentences in reported speech.
content.explanation: El modal 'can' cambia a 'could' en el discurso indirecto.

options.text: Maria said she can help me.
Maria said she could help me.
Maria said she is able to help me.
Maria says she could help you.

content.prompt_es: Fill in the blanks with the correct words to complete the conditional sentences.
content.main_text:
If it ___ tomorrow, we will go to the beach.

If I ___ more time, I would travel around the world.

If you study hard, you ___ pass the exam.

If he ___ more careful, he would not make mistakes.

If they invite us, we ___ go to the party.
content.explanation:
(1) Usamos el presente simple 'rains' porque es una condición real para el futuro.
(2) Usamos 'had' en la segunda condicional para situaciones irreales en el pasado.
(3) Aquí usamos 'will' porque es una condición real en el presente o futuro.
(4) En la segunda condicional, usamos 'were' para situaciones hipotéticas o irreales.
(5) Usamos 'will' porque es una respuesta a una posible acción futura.
